member.summary: Constructor which allows to set current time.
member.param: Service used to provide current time used in service methods.
Publishes assets added to the campaign.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignScheduleService.Launch(CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignInfo,System.Int32)
member.summary: The method launches the specified campaign ().
member.remarks:
Launching a campaign includes the following steps:
The campaign starts tracking data.
All linked page assets are published.
All linked email assets are sent.
Does not launch an already launched campaign or a campaign from a different site. When pages are published, is set to . is reset if the date is set to past. Pages under workflow are left untouched and all culture variants are published.
member.param: ID of the site on which the campaign is launched.
member.returns: True if the campaign has been launched.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignScheduleService.Finish(CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignInfo,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Finishes the specified campaign (). Data will not be tracked anymore. Doesn't finish an already finished campaign.
member.param: ID of the site on which the campaign is finished.
Time when the campaign is finished. If null, is used.
member.returns: True if the campaign has been finished.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignScheduleService.Schedule(CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignInfo,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: Plans the launch and finish of the specified campaign () in future.
member.remarks: A scheduled task is created for the campaign launch. The task is executed based on the parameter.
member.param: ID of the site on which the campaign is scheduled.
member.returns: True if the campaign has been scheduled.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignScheduleService.Reschedule(CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignInfo,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: Re-plans the launch and finish of the specified campaign () in future. This is only possible if the campaign has not been launched or finished yet.
member.remarks: A scheduled task is updated for the campaign launch. The task is executed based on the parameter.
member.param: ID of site on which the campaign is re-scheduled.
member.returns: True if the campaign has been re-scheduled.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignScheduleService.Unschedule(CMS.WebAnalytics.CampaignInfo)
member.summary: Unplans the launch and finish of the specified campaign. This is only possible if the campaign has already been planned.
member.remarks: A scheduled task is removed and will not be executed.
member.returns: True if the campaign has been unscheduled.

member.name: T:CMS.WebAnalytics.IWebAnalyticsServiceScriptsGenerator
member.summary: Service for generating JavaScript code which is able to call the external web service via AJAX. Before using the generated JS snippet, you need to manually create global WebServiceCall(url, method, parameters) JavaScript function either by calling ScriptHelper.RegisterWebServiceCallFunction(page) or manually.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.IWebAnalyticsServiceScriptsGenerator.GetLogBannerHitScript(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns script which logs BannerHit asynchronously.
member.param: ID of the banner which was viewed

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.IWebAnalyticsServiceScriptsGenerator.GetLogSearchScript(CMS.DocumentEngine.PageInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Returns script which logs Search statistics asynchronously.

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.IWebAnalyticsServiceScriptsGenerator.GetLogHitsScriptWithSubstitute(System.String)
member.summary: Returns script which logs page views and other hits asynchronously. The script does not contain the actual parameters. There is a placeholder at the location where parameters would be and this placeholder should be replaced by the actual parameters before sending page output to the client browser. This two-step rendering is required, because of the output cache mechanism. At first, there is a universal script rendered and saved into cache. This universal script is then updated with values specific for the current request before sending HTTP response back to the client browser.
member.param: String which will be placed at the location where parameters would normally be

member.name: M:CMS.WebAnalytics.IWebAnalyticsServiceScriptsGenerator.GetLogHitsParameters(CMS.DocumentEngine.PageInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Returns parameters of the LogHits call in JSON format.
member.param: PageInfo representing current document/node. Cannot be null
Url of the page where the user came from (http referrer). Can be null
